org.modelio.api.diagram

Interface IDiagramNode

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDiagramGraphic
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDiagramDG

    public interface IDiagramNode
extends IDiagramGraphic
    This class represents a DiagramGraphic of the 'node' kind.

    • Method Summary

      • fitToContent

        void fitToContent()
        Resize this diagram node to fit its content.

      • getFillColor

        String getFillColor()
        Get the current fill color.
        Might return null if the corresponding style key isn't defined.
        Returns:
        The fill color.

      • getFillMode

        int getFillMode()
        Get the current fill mode.
        - 0 : The figure must be transparent.
        - 1 : The figure is filled with a solid color.
        - 2 : The figure is filled with a gradient.
        Returns:
        The fill mode.

      • getFont

        String getFont()
        Get the current font, represented by font data.

        A valid font data representation is a string of the form fontname-style-height where fontname is the name of a font, style is a font style (one of "regular", "bold", "italic", or "bold italic") and height is an integer representing the font height. Example: Times New Roman-bold-36.


        Might return null if the corresponding style key isn't defined.
        Returns:
        The font.

      • getLineColor

        String getLineColor()
        Get the current line color.
        Might return null if the corresponding style key isn't defined.
        Returns:
        The line color.

      • getLineWidth

        int getLineWidth()
        Get the current line width.
        Returns:
        The line width.

      • getNodes

        List<IDiagramNode> getNodes()
        Return the list of children nodes of this node.
        Returns:
        A list of nodes in any case, possibly an empty one. Never returns null

      • setFillMode

        void setFillMode(int value)
        Modify the current fill mode. - 0 : The figure must be transparent.
        - 1 : The figure is filled with a solid color.
        - 2 : The figure is filled with a gradient.
        Parameters:
        value - The new fill mode.

      • setFont

        void setFont(String value)
      throws org.eclipse.jface.resource.DataFormatException
        Modify the current font.

        This method fails if the value does not represent font data.

        A valid font data representation is a string of the form fontname-style-height where fontname is the name of a font, style is a font style (one of "regular", "bold", "italic", or "bold italic") and height is an integer representing the font height. Example: Times New Roman-bold-36.

        Parameters:
        value - The new font.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.jface.resource.DataFormatException - if the given value does not represent font data

      • setLineColor

        void setLineColor(String value)
        Modify the current line color.
        Parameters:
        value - The new line color.

      • setLineWidth

        void setLineWidth(int value)
        Modify the current line width.
        Parameters:
        value - The new line width.

      • setLocation

        boolean setLocation(int x,
                    int y)
        Change the location of the node, setting its new position to (x,y). Note however that the requested change might no be performed when some layout constraints are maintained by the parent of the node (ie the requested change is refused or adapted by the parent of the node).
        Parameters:
        x - the new X position
        y - the new Y position
        Returns:
        true if the change could be requested (different from 'performed' see note above)

      • setRepresentationMode

        void setRepresentationMode(int value)
        Modify the current representation mode.
        - 0 : simple mode
        - 1 : structured mode
        - 2 : image mode
        Parameters:
        value - The new representation mode.

      • setSize

        boolean setSize(int width,
                int height)
        Change the size of the node to (width,height).
        Note however that the requested change might no be performed when some layout constraints are maintained by the parent of the node (ie the requested change is refused or adapted by the parent of the node).
        Parameters:
        width - the new width
        height - the new height
        Returns:
        true if the change could be requested (different from 'performed' see note above)

      • setTextColor

        void setTextColor(String value)
        Modify the current text color.
        Parameters:
        value - The new text color.

        org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Rectangle getBounds()
        Return the node location and size as a Rectangle.
        Returns:
        the node bounds.

      • getElement

        MObject getElement()
        Description copied from interface: IDiagramGraphic
        Get the element this IDiagramGraphic is related to.

        Note: May return null if the element is not resolved. or the graphic does not represent a model element, such as diagram drawings..

        Specified by:
        getElement in interface IDiagramGraphic
        Returns:
        the represented element or null if the element is not resolved.

      • setBounds

        void setBounds(org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Rectangle newBounds)
        This method changes both the location and the size of a node by changing its current bounds.
        Note however that the requested change might no be performed when some layout constraints are maintained by the parent of the node (ie the requested changes are refused or adapted by the parent of the node).
        Parameters:
        newBounds - the new node bounds

      • getOverallBounds

        org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Rectangle getOverallBounds()
        Return the location and size as a Rectangle for the node, including its satellites.

        When no satellites are displayed, returns the same value as getBounds().

        Returns:
        the node bounds.
        Since:
        3.1
